{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this situation, the investigator wants to study the association between a categorical variable (maternal intake of iron supplements) and a continuous variable (birth weights of newborn babies). The appropriate statistical test for this scenario is the independent t-test. The independent t-test is used to compare the means of two independent groups. In this case, the investigator can compare the mean birth weights of newborns whose mothers took iron supplements with those whose mothers did not take iron supplements. Therefore, the answer choice is B. Unpaired or independent t-test.", "answer_choice": "B"}
